sentences: Joshua Scott "JC" Chasez (; born August 8, 1976) is an American singer, songwriter, dancer, record producer, and occasional actor.
Chasez was born on August 8, 1976, in Bowie, Maryland.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: When he was five years old, his biological mother entrusted guardianship of her son to her own former foster parents Roy and Karen Chasez, who worked as a technology company consultant and an editor, respectively.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In 1989, his mother Karen Chasez noticed a small ad in the Washington Post announcing auditions for Disney's The Mickey Mouse Club and encouraged Chasez to try out.
section: == Career ==

sentences: The band never formally disbanded, but since 2004, members have stated that the band is done and has no plans to record new music or tour.

sentences: In August 2013, JC rejoined with Timberlake and the rest of NSYNC for a one-time performance at the MTV Video Music Awards.

sentences: In April 2019, Chasez reunited with bandmates Lance Bass, Joey Fatone, and Chris Kirkpatrick for a one-night performance as part of Ariana Grande's headlining set at Coachella.

== Career == | === 2002-2007: Solo career, Schizophrenic and Story of Kate ===

sentences: While still a member of NSYNC, Chasez appeared on the remix and album versions of the 1999 single "Bring It All to Me" by the girl group Blaque, though his vocals were credited to NSYNC as a whole.
section: == Career == | === 2002-2007: Solo career, Schizophrenic and Story of Kate ===

sentences: After the release of his first solo single in 2002, "Blowin' Me Up (With Her Love)", co-produced by Dallas Austin for the Drumline soundtrack, Chasez began work on a solo album that was scheduled for a 2003 release by Jive Records.

sentences: Promotion for the album was affected by former bandmate Justin Timberlake and Janet Jackson's Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show controversy, after which Chasez was unceremoniously dropped from his halftime show performance at the 2004 Pro Bowl.
